line_1: Perhaps you might expect some finish'd Ode,
line_2: Or sacred Song, to sound the Praise of God;

line_1: And waken Mem'ry with a sleeping ode.
line_2: Invoke the Muse to quit her calm abode,

line_1: To her arch cub, hath hitch'd into an ode;
line_2: THORNTON, whilst HUMOUR pointed out the road

line_1: And more an Hiero's palm, a Pindar's ode,
line_2: Than all th' united plates of George bestow'd.

line_1: Strut in Iambics, totter in an Ode,
line_2: Promise, and never pay, and be the mode.

line_1: Lie all neglected like the Birthday Ode.
line_2: For lo! these fav'rites of the ancient mode

line_1: I saw t'other Day in a Thing call'd an Ode,
line_2: As it lay in a snug little House on the Road,

line_1: I stray, and suppliant kneel, an ode
line_2: Whilst in her once belov'd abode
